channel.title: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India
channel.description: World News: TOI brings the latest world news headlines, Current International breaking news world wide. In depth analysis and top news headlines world wide.

image.title: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India

item.title: Harris' team pushes back as ABC News says it will mute mics during Trump-Kamala debate
item.description: ​The ABC news Thursday confirmed that the September 10 debate on the channel will have the same rules as the CNN debate and the mics will be muted when the other candidate is speaking. Kamala Harris' team wanted mics to be unmuted but ABC News rejected the request. Like the CNN debate, there will be no audience, no notes and they will not be allowed to speak when the other candidate is speaking.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 21-year-old student from Nepal found dead in Houston after armed robbery
item.description: Muna Pandey, a 21-year-old community college student from Nepal, was found shot dead in her Houston apartment following an armed robbery. Police have arrested Bobby Sinh Shah, 52, in connection with the crime. Pandey had moved to Houston from Nepal in 2021, as noted by a GoFundMe fundraiser set up for her.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Tension in Kamala Harris' 'Frankenstein' team amid clashes between Obama, Biden alums
item.description: Kamala Harris's presidential campaign is a mix of Obama alums and Biden holdovers which creates occasional confusion and clashes. Harris's team includes her own staff and key figures from Biden's and Obama's campaigns. Efforts to integrate Biden's group have led to role uncertainty, but the focus is on delivering results before the election.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Elon Musk reacts to claims that Brazil blocked Starlink accounts: 'Lapdog, outright criminal'
item.description: Elon Musk criticized Brazil's President Lula and Supreme Court Justice Alexandre de Moraes after Brazil reportedly froze Starlink's bank accounts over fines against X, formerly Twitter. The court has given Musk 24 hours to designate a legal representative for X in Brazil, risking a potential ban. Musk accuses Moraes of censoring conservative voices.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Over 1,000 dead, hundreds blinded in Bangladesh protests against Sheikh Hasina: Interim government
item.description: The protests against Sheikh Hasina's government have resulted in over 1,000 deaths, as reported by the interim administration led by Nobel laureate Muhammad Yunus. Health adviser Nurjahan Begum disclosed the extent of injuries among civilians and police, including significant vision losses. The interim government is committed to holding fair elections after implementing essential reforms.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Couple's romance in car go wrong as SUV submerges in Philadelphia river
item.description: In Philadelphia, a couple's SUV rolled into the Schuylkill River during an intimate moment when the woman kicked the gear shift by mistake. The incident took place early in the morning around 4:45 am. The couple managed to escape without injuries, and the police retrieved their vehicle a few hours later, with no charges filed.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Know someone with lavish life, no job?': South Yorkshire police's post viral as people report Royal Family
item.description: South Yorkshire Police’s appeal on social media to identify individuals enjoying a luxurious lifestyle without any apparent jobs received an unexpected reaction. Many users humorously reported the Royal Family and high-profile figures including former PM Boris Johnson, present PM Keir Starmer. The appeal was part of an effort to combat economic crime in the region, the post said.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Former detective Matthew Farwell charged with murdering pregnant woman and staging it as suicide
item.description: Matthew Farwell, a former police detective in Massachusetts, stands accused of murdering Sandra Birchmore to conceal their illicit relationship. Initially misjudged as a suicide, her death revealed signs of violence after further investigation. Farwell allegedly staged the scene and maintained an inappropriate relationship with Birchmore. Stoughton Police Chief Donna McNamara condemned the alleged murder as “the single worst act of not just professional misconduct but human indecency” she has witnessed in her career. Farwell resigned and faces severe charges.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: At least 9 dead in massive listeria outbreak linked to Boar’s Head deli meats
item.description: Federal health officials have reported nine deaths and 57 illnesses due to listeria infections linked to Boar’s Head deli meats. The outbreak, traced to a Virginia plant’s liverwurst, prompted a recall of over 7 million pounds of products distributed nationwide and internationally. In Virginia, 88-year-old Gunter “Garshon” Morgenstein died on July 18 from a brain infection caused by listeria linked to the contaminated Boar’s Head products
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Islamic Jihad commander killed in gunbattle at West Bank mosque, claims Israel
item.description: Israeli troops killed Muhammad Jabber, a commander of the Islamic Jihad movement, and four militants near a mosque in Tulkarm. This major military operation involved hundreds of troops, helicopters, and drones, leading to 17 Palestinian deaths over two days. Violence has intensified during the nearly 11-month-long Gaza conflict.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Iran has further increased its stockpile of uranium enriched to near weapons-grade levels, UN says
item.description: The UN's nuclear watchdog reports that Iran has increased its stockpile of uranium enriched to near weapons-grade levels, now at 164.7 kilograms up to 60%. Tehran banned experienced nuclear inspectors and disrupted surveillance cameras. Despite these actions, Iran's supreme leader indicated a willingness to renew negotiations with the US under President Masoud Pezeshkian's government.

item.title: US presidential elections: Will Arlington cemetery incident become Trump's political graveyard?
item.description: Donald Trump’s visit to Arlington National Cemetery marks a contentious moment, as critics claim he used the anniversary to uplift his election campaign. His team asserts he was invited by families of the deceased soldiers, but cemetery officials advised against politicization. The event has sparked division among military veterans.
item.dc:creator: Chidanand Rajghatta

item.title: Tulsi Gabbard shares one suggestion that she would give Trump to debate Kamala Harris
item.description: Former Democrat leader Tulsi Gabbard, who earlier debated Kamala Harris, is now assisting Donald Trump in preparation for their upcoming debate on ABC. Gabbard criticizes Harris’s record, calling her a liar, and says Trump will focus on exposing Harris’s record. The debate will follow earlier CNN rules, including muted microphones, standing format, and no sheets allowed.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 20 migrants try to break in California school bus picking up students
item.description: Approximately 20 migrants allegedly tried to board a California school bus on Wednesday, leading to immediate action by parents and the bus driver to ensure student safety. The Jamul-Dulzura Union School District reported the incident to multiple authorities, including US Border Patrol and San Diego County Sheriff’s Department. As the investigation continues, Superintendent Bystedt has instructed all bus drivers to bypass stops where migrants are present, emphasizing the district’s commitment to safety.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Two Hong Kong journalists found guilty of conspiring to publish seditious content
item.description: Two former editors of the now-closed Hong Kong independent media outlet Stand News, Patrick Lam and Chung Pui-kuen, have been convicted of conspiring to publish seditious materials. The court ruled that 11 of 17 articles promoted illegal ideologies against Hong Kong and Chinese governments. The parent company, Best Pencil Ltd, was also found guilty.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Trump's first reaction ahead of Kamala Harris-CNN interview: 'When they ask her a question...'
item.description: Kamala Harris, the Democratic presidential nominee, is set to give her first interview with CNN tonight alongside her running mate Tim Walz. Former President Donald Trump criticized the interview for being taped and edited, and questioned why Harris needs Walz with her. This interview aims to address criticisms against Harris for not engaging with the press recently.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: US presidential elections: Trump&Co sink to new low with ugly sexual slurs against Kamala
item.description: Former President Donald Trump amplified another sexist slur against Kamala Harris on social media. His followers continue similar attacks amid Harris gaining in battleground state polls. Political pundits note Trump’s misogynistic history is driving away female voters, potentially impacting his election chances. Trump often denies unfavorable poll results.
item.dc:creator: Chidanand Rajghatta

item.title: Enraged passenger smashes computers at airport. He was sold fake American Airlines ticket
item.description: A Haitian man was detained at Santiago's Nuevo Pudahuel Airport in Chile after causing $20,000 worth of damage. He went on a rampage with a hammer when he realized the American Airlines ticket sold to him was fake. The incident was caught on camera and the man went on smashing the computers and screaming. He was later handed over to police after being restrained by airport security.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Is UK planning to ban smoking? Here's what PM Starmer said
item.description: British Prime Minister Keir Starmer has announced plans for more stringent anti-smoking measures, which could ban smoking in outdoor areas like pubs and restaurants. The Labour government aims to reduce smoking-related deaths and healthcare costs. Additionally, they plan to reintroduce legislation to gradually raise the tobacco purchasing age, potentially making smoking illegal for future generations.
item.dc:creator: TOI News Desk

item.title: Police kills man on Piscataqua River Bridge, body of an 8-yr-old found from his car
item.description: On Thursday morning, police shot dead a man on the I-95 bridge connecting Maine and New Hampshire and then found a body of an eight-year-old in his car. The man was believed to be in the run after killing a woman in Troy, New Hampshire. The bridge is now closed for investigation, with authorities indicating no threat to the public.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk
